title: What Happened to CDR?
body:
Remember the days when you actually had to decide if you wanted CDR, and if so build for it? Now it just feels like something that is built in, and it is more of a challenge trying to not pass CDR cap on almost every champion.

I believe their reasoning likely falls into one or more of these categories:

1) They want to make "easier" build paths (warhammer, codex) and since the new item paths they choose have CDR in them they have to throw it into the final item.

2) They don't know how to trim power on items in other ways, so they just minus some AP/AD and throw CDR on there to try and compensate.

3) They want to eliminate CDR as something people build towards and make it something that is just acquired naturally through item purchases.

4) They simply don't know what they are doing.

With the introduction of the new rune that converts excess CDR into AD/AP, it feels like they are just avoiding the fact that it might be an issue that it is so easy to obtain so much CDR, and instead of making changes so that it is an actual thought process they are throwing in a rune that allows even less thinking about the CDR cap.

Perhaps it is my stubbornness for change but I really miss building towards CDR on some champs and wish it could go back to being less items containing CDR, even if it means more CDR on each of said items.

replies.body: TBH I miss the AP values of old more than I care about the abundance of CDR
Reached full build on Malz today with ~630AP, build had a Rabadons in it too. It was pretty sad.
hopefully the will raise the CDR cap and then add CDR onto more items so the standard mode slowly becomes URF

That is actually their plan

when they first released urf they stated that this was the future of league

and were already halfway there

Wait... Really?

Do you have source on this?
They stated it was the future of league as an April Fools joke lol
Not sure if it actually was a joke though, have you seen itemization lately, nearly everyone runs around with 30-45% cdr these days

I don't share your problems with this, I generally don't want to build CDR but I have to on some champions. When I play tanks, I'll most likely finish the game with sub 40 CDR. When I play ADC, same thing. The vast majority of the time when I'm jungling, sub 40, though some champions want 40% more than others. Depending on who I play mid, literally same thing. In fact, I find myself foregoing CDR. For instance, I'll very often buy Lost Chapter instead of Fiendish Codex, and even after I buy the codex I don't upgrade to morello right away, despite it giving me 10% more CDR. 

And the decisions for CDR are still present, even if they are fleshed out because people know how to better play the game. All of the mid laners I know run 10% CDR runes so we don't have to buy it in items. I'm sorry I just feel like I'm totally missing your point.
So you forego getting some of the best items right away simply because you dont like cdr?

The opposite, in fact; I forego CDR to get some of the best items. 

Some of the obvious cases: Ryze, Leblanc, Ahri, Taliyah, Karthus, Akali, Cass, Kass, Katarina, Vladimir, okay that's enough. 

The point is, there's no minigame in league where you're trying to hit 40% asap, and there's a variety of situations where it's much better to buy a different item than it is to rush more CDR.

And each one you just named are specific cases where they get a RoA or tear first or are an assasin who wants to rush a high dmg burst, (with the exception of vlad who just doesnt build it sometimes) leblanc is kite mage assasin thing, taliyah can rush morello,  akali is an assasin. Kassadin is an assasin,  katarina, an assasin.
Almost every mage who doesnt rely on RoA or Tear rushes morello.

I'm confused.

This entire post was about how it's League of CDR etc etc, while you're saying there's at least 2 subtypes of mid laners who completely forego rushing CDR? There are also ADCs which very rarely rush any kind of CDR. Tanks are typically not rushing CDR for any reason whatsoever, similar to some bruisers. 

So some champs do want CDR, others do not. I fail to see how there's any reason to complain about CDR. Like I said, no champions in the entire game have a minigame of rushing 40%. Not a single champion.

No, the post is about how before if you wanted cdr, you had to build towards it, and give up some dmg. Now its in most staple items for all the classes. The  rush item for pretty much every mage has cdr.  And even if you dont rush morello, you build RoA into morello.

Firstly, there are quite a few mages that never build morello. Secondly, there are a huge portion of mages who aren't rushing Morello because of the CDR. The passive from Lost chapter is infinitely better than fiendish codex. 

As for what the post is about, that's literally how it still is. If you want CDR, you have to build towards it. Not every champion wants it. As for mages specifically, the mages we're refferring to _have always rushed CDR_. Whether they end up at 40% is what I thought we were talking about. Of course you will do far more damage if you don't build every CDR item.
Name 5 mid lane mages who dont build morello?

To actually reply to you question:

Twisted Fate, Karthus, Swain, Viktor, Vladimir, Azir, Aurelion Sol, Lissandra, Karma, Annie, Kayle

Most of these champions are Tear users or RoA users. This isn't to say these champions never build Morello, I just searched highest win rate builds on op.gg to ensure Morello is 'less winning' if it is a viable item on the champion.

I generally end up with 30 cdr from my build and use the blue buff when I can for the other 10 so I can fit liandrys into my build. Morello, liandry, void, death cap n either zhonya or banshee, on most standard mages. That's just me tho

Nah it's me too. The only reason i hit max CDR is because 10% scaling CDR runes.

Mages dont usually build both zhonyas and Banshees to gain the other 20% needed for a cap, neither lichbane. The other options (hextech belt or lucidity boots) means you'll miss out on damage. Building both banshees and zhonyas is also not a lot of damahe

Annie is my main midlaner (which is my least favourite role, I admit) and Morello is definitely a solid starter for her. I'm not sure if ROA is better, it serves different playstyles. On op.gg, there are 5 listed core builds, 4 of them contain morello, one of them roa. Either most people are too stuborn to get ROA or ROA is more of a snowball item that you tend to buy if you get a lot of cash early to get those 10 stacks sooner.
That would explain the higher win rate then; people usually don't understand that higher win rate builds may be due to already being ahead and snowballing rather than it being the best item.

Mages are building {{item:3165}} over {{item:3027}} because of the CDR. Of course you first need mana. Getting CDR before you have the mana to spam it is silly. But they buy the chapter because it leads to an early item with whooping 20% CDR in it.

The raw stats of morello are just better, 20 more ap and 100 more mana than ROA. Of course this original post was really the "League was better in season 1" circle jerk although the vast majority of players started in season 3-4 when the standard, even then, was 20% CDR on the core item for mages. 

My entire point was that we don't buy the item for CDR as the OP implied. We're buying it because it gives the raw power and sustain that we need (if we're rushing it) and that the only class that actually rushes this item are the 'standard' mages. Assassins, tanks, ADCs, Tear/ROA users, hell even some mages, as I've mentioned, don't rush CDR immediately. It's hard to argue for 'League of CDR' when there are a ton of champs that buy CDR situationally and when the majority of champs don't even cap out the majority of the time.

ROA gives 100 ap and 400 mana on top of 500 hp at full stacks. Granted that it's not an immediate power spike, it's also 200g cheaper and gives some health sustain. Morello gives more mana sustain, though and GW is just a bonus that you get for free.

I'm comparing these two items because both give similar stats: mana and AP, but Morello gives it faster and gives CDR instead of 500 hp. So it's not that you buy morello just for the mana or just for the ap. There are other options and a lot of mages still go for the morello because of the CDR that comes with it. Perhaps the competition is simply too weak. I know that many champs need the mana, but would actually prefer more AP instead of CDR or hp. But Riot probably doesn't want too much AP because 1 hit combos are pretty lame to play against.

Kayle rushes 40% CDR, no exceptions.

I can't think of any other champions in which it is a necessity to rush CDR though,
so the rest of your points are well made. :)

I usually see Kayle getting Nashor into Guinsoo's or Wit's End depending on matchup; rarely do I see a Nashor into another CDR item. I'm not a Kayle player though so I'm just judging this off of op.gg builds.

That's because most Kayle builds include 20% scaling CDR in the runes.
So I suppose it's easier to hit CDR cap in those regards :d
Why the fuck don't you want 40% on Ahri. It's super easy to achieve too. Morellos, Zhonya's, and Lich/BV make 40%. If you really want you can run 10% scaling in runes and cut 10% out.

I never said I don't ever want to hit 40%, I said I'm not trying to hit it asap. Depending on the game, Ahri for example, I typically am not building BV and Zhonya's, while Lich is a very situation item. Deathcap, Void Staff, Gunblade, Luden's, Rylai's, Liandry's, none of these items have CDR. There's a reason people take 10% CDR in runes, it's so we don't have to buy it. If CDR was just automatically better than everything else, NO ONE would take CDR runes in any role. That's just not the case. Also, the cute little 5% CDR mastery would be much more popular, instead there's like 2 champions in the game that actually want to run it.

Forgo usually implies not going for.

Even then Morellos puts you at 20% as a first item. Only two items I'd say are necessities are Morello's and Void Staff plus Boots of course. Slotting two 10% CDR items in there isn't hard imo and since I'm fond of Lich Bane builds I find I often overcap CDR if I run my 10% CDR runes.

In the context of my comment, it's pretty clear that I mean I 'do without' or forego early CDR in favor of higher damage. I typically do not finish Morello's as first item on many champions. It's certainly not an item that I rush on every single mage, while it is often in my builds. 

And again in the context of the post, we're only talking about one class of champions: mages.

Yeah I agree trying to not go over 40% is way harder than trying to get to 40% ever was. I find it especially hard on any bruisers. I mean I don't mind having 40% CDr all the time but it would be nice to not feel terrible wasting gold on something I don't need when I'm already at 50%

Wow....OP apparently never plays anything other than a mage. While a lot of mages can hit 40% pretty easy with standard builds a LOT of champs won't find themselves there. 
If anything, CDR has become more of a thing because Riot is reducing the stats of the game. There is less AP and HP compared to seasons ago when you could have 6000 or more HP on a tank. 
Frankly less AP and more CDR changes the skill needed. You can throw spells more quickly, but it's not like before when one mage combo would melt all but the tankiest of champs. Now some proper chaining and care in skill shots matters more and you get a little faster rotations.

that imo is a lot and there are many for tanks, all supports get that 40% and if u need it oon adc just go ER u get 30% + 10% runes or maw or youmuu or death dance, assassins get it with yoummu cleaver duskblade death dance tanks get it with visage warmog knight vow i mean the op has a point.

If an ADC doesn't build ER, and only some do, they will not hit Max CDR or possibly overcap themselves.

The point is that some CDR is common, some matches and champs you may not care if you have it, and others may prioritize it over other stats. 

It's not like EVERY champ EVERY game is over CDR cap, which is what OP dramatically makes it seem like.

This is why all adcs that need CDR builds {{item:3508}}, as a tank if you need a lot of CDR u just go {{item:3025}} {{item:3065}} and then {{item:3109}}  if you need armor {{item:3001}} if you need MR or {{item:3083}} for just  raw hp.
What the op is saying is that before if you wanted CDR you had to sacrifice other stats, {{item:3165}}  for instance had 60 ap, so you could choose between that and {{item:3285}} for burst as a start.

This isn't true.

I played the new champion Kayn today and one thing I eventually realized is that his recommended build (which is basically what you want every assassin to build) overcaps his CD.

{{item:1400}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3142}} {{item:3147}} , this is the ideal build you would want to have when playing Shadow Assassin Kayn. But would you look at that, 50% CDR for just buying assassin items, combine that with potential 10% CDR from blue buff and you got a huge overcap. Other AD assassins basically build everything but Warriors, ending at 40% CDR, capped for just buying the only armor pen items in the game.

Funny you say only armor pen items but completely forget the Mortal Reminder or LDR. 
Frankly with Kayn, I don't see the point of Duskblade. OK, sure you get Lethality and an on-hit bonus, but if you use his sneaky pathing well, you will probably rarely ever get caught by a ward while ganking. 
Some assassin types would benefit as much if not more from the Bloodrazor enchant on their jungle item. 
Can you get too much CDR in a build? Yes. But are you losing out on a stat an alternate item would provide? Is it a major loss?
Oh, and way to be greedy jungler, gotta keep your blue at all times and not share to lanes. :P

Duskblade is actually good as it adds a lot of damage, gives CDR the passive is not only useful for wards when ganking (btw i do not see why you should not get caught by a ward, if enemies are not bronze they ward so unless you have a pink ward from where you are going to gank there is a chance to get spotted when {{item:3341}}  is on CD) but also to see if there are wards in your jungle or at objectives, and moreover the initial 99% slow makes it really easy for some CC to chain like {{champion:202}} W.
And considering assassins do not build crit, want to burst squishy so more lethality is useful, it is not a lose of stats unless you want a bit of tankyness but in that case you are going for a different playstyle. 
And in some cases you will get blue, either need to smite it to prevent enemies invading from getting it, perhaps when you are counterjungling blue is up, you might kill someone with a blue buff ecc...

My point about Dusk blade in regard to Kayn specifically is with his E you can really path in a variety of ways where wards won't give warning, so if you play very clever you don't rely on that item for surprise attacks like other assassins might. There are some nice other perks to Duskblade, and I'm not trying to say it's useless, but one of its major selling points for others isn't so necessary with him. If you feel you are losing in some stat area to CDR, you have options to flex.
Duskblade mostly strong on him because you get to proc the passive twice rapidly: once when coming in from gank, and again after ulting. That's a good chunk of extra burst.

Actually my #1 played in ranked this season is Nasus... so.... wrong there. I don't play mid/mages more than anything else.

I like having CDR, don't get me wrong. It just feels like a struggle to NOT overcap since they put CDR on so many items. "Lethality on maw? OP.... switch it to CDR!" "Too much AP on Zhonyas w/ its utility? OP ... switch some to CDR!" "Duskblade too hard to build for assassins? Swap the build path to warhammer... and slap the CDR on it!" I just wish it was more of a deciding factor in what items you wanted to buy, instead of almost always just being an eventuality that you'll hit cap no matter what you build.

I remember when building cdr on champs like {{champion:75}} or {{champion:45}} was a unique thing that was specific to their kits. I also remember a time when, if i dodged an apc's cc once, i would eventually catch up to it. Now they just use it again in a few seconds.

People realized cdr on mages is super super good. So they stopped buying things like{{item:3089}} and started buying cdr items. This isn't new and it wasn't caused by Riot. For the longest time we had every ap carry buying {{item:3174}} because it solved mana and easily gave them 40 cdr. The problem is that ap carries have alot of downtime between rotations if they don't buy cdr so they all buy cdr. Waiting 6 seconds instead of 8 can win a fight.

You are mistaken. People didn't realize such a thing because it was never viable before the introduction of keystones and before the mage update arrived. If you built cdr on mages before pre-season 6. you'd tickle your enemies. Everyone was going for flat AP.

Then, keystones arrived and all that flat AP became too powerful. So, Riot forced cdr down everyone's throats as a compensation for removing AP out of most AP items.

You're also a little mistaken. Players were eager for more CDR availability and even requested at the expense of flat AP. They were tired of having to use runes to pad the last ten percent they needed for the cap.

The only champions I ever remember going flat ap were champs like {{champion:30}} and {{champion:34}} . Everyone else loved cdr. You are right that riot did change items to benefit mages but not because they have a thing for cdr but more to attempt to fix item diversity. If you have a problem with high cdr builds what you really should be complaning about is morellonomicon because it is the biggest offender and is really the only reason most mages can get 40% cdr without 3 cdr items. To my knowledge it is the only mage item that gives 20% cdr.

As far as big ticket mage items they haven't been changed too much. 
Most received cost increases in patch 5.22 but that was a mage wide balancing thing.  For example. Rabadon's has not received any changes since patch 5.22 when it had its cost increased. from 3500 to 3800. 5.13 we had a damage increase on Rabadon's with a price increase. 5% more bonus ap. From 30% to 35%. and price increase from 3300 to 3500. It has not had its ap decreased since season 2.

Archangel's staff. Got more damage but got a cost increase same as most other mage items. 20 more ap and 300 more gold. Also in patch 5.13 and patch 5.22.

Morellonomicon got more damage and other stuff but more damage and a cost increase. Side note this is one of the biggest cdr options in the game right now. This happened in patch 6.9

Zhonya's is one of the few that actually got less damage in these amge tune ups. It got less damage and cdr and longer cd on active but cheaper cost.

Rod of Ages has had its ap nerfed in 6.12 but that was deserved and it also got a cheaper price tag to go along with it.

Nash gives 20.

Other 20 items are frozen heart, ibg, and tri.

Mages need a 20 item as it allows for build diversity, otherwise they would have to build more cookie cutter.

Sorry on my phone
I forgot about nashor's tooth but it is such a niche item that I don't count it for most mage discussions. I also agree that a 20% cdr item is needed for mages.

They slapped cdr on almost everything, lowered the cost of nearly ever mage item, and heavily increased the cost of deathcap.  People didn't realize anything.  Riot changed the items so that cdr was a better buildpath and item selection than raw ap. Lol.
